page.title: 19BUCKLAND NEWTON HOUSING
page.content: There are{132}dwellings most of which are detached and arranged in "ribbon development" along the main roads. The majority of houses are pre 1940 although over a third of the total have been built since 1940. 16 properties have been erected in the last 10 years.Building materials for walls vary from brick and flint,brick and stone,mixtures of brick,factory produced stone,rough cement to pebble dash.There is also a wide range of roofing materials with the majority being tiles but thatch,slate and cement tile are also being used.A few dwellings remain "tied"to the occupation.Some of the farms and farm houses belong to the Holford Estate whilst others belong to the council and the rest are privately owned.
